concepts.concept_description: Memorizing already taught numbers, i.e. integers, whole numbers, natural numbers
What are rational numbers, need for rational numbers

successors.concept_description: Showing that a rational number can be written with different numerators and denominators called as Equivalent rational numbers
Based on positive and negative sign of numerator and denominator showing positive and negative rational numbers, Taking reciprocal and resultant rational number

successors.concept_name: Rational Numbers on a Number Line
successors.concept_description: Representation of rational numbers on number line
What is standard form of any rational number, How to convert any rational number in its standard form
Comparing two positive, two negative rational numbers, Comparison of a negative and a positive rational number with the help of number line

successors.concept_name: Rational Numbers between Two Rational Numbers
successors.concept_description: unlimited number of rational numbers between any two rational numbers. Introducing rational numbers between integers and between rational numbers
Addition of rational numbers, while adding rational numbers with same denominators, we add the numerators keeping the denominators same, Addition when denominators are different

successors.concept_name: Additive Inverse of a Rational Number
successors.concept_description: What is additive inverse, how to find additive inverse of any rational number
Subtracting two rational numbers, we add the additive inverse of the rational number that is being subtracted, to the other rational number, Subtraction when denominators are same and different

successors.concept_name: Multiplication and Division of Rational Numbers
successors.concept_description: Steps to do multiplication and division of rational numbers. Showing few examples with the help of number line
Closure, associative, commutative, distributive etc. properties of rational numbers, Proof with examples

rational numbers are closed under addition and subtraction. That is, for any two rational numbers a and b, a + b is also a rational number and a – b is also a rational number; rational numbers are closed under multiplication.
Commutative property of rational numbers and integers.
Associative property of integers and rational numbers
For all rational numbers a, b and c, a(b + c) = ab + ac and a(b – c) = ab – ac

concepts.concept_description: How to take LCM, and how important it is while adding two rational numbers

successors.concept_description: Addition of rational numbers, while adding rational numbers with same denominators, we add the numerators keeping the denominators same, Addition when denominators are different

successors.concept_name: Additive Inverse of a Rational Number
successors.concept_description: What is additive inverse, how to find additive inverse of any rational number
Subtracting two rational numbers, we add the additive inverse of the rational number that is being subtracted, to the other rational number, Subtraction when denominators are same and different
